message:
Netanyahu, Prime Minister of Israel, is sitting on a chair, one foot on the other (there were also references to this matter specifically, as you will see), inside the Palestinian territory in the Gaza Strip, while the leader of Hamas, Yahya Sinwar, is hiding in a tunnel, not showing his face throughout the months of the war and never visiting the residents of the Gaza Strip, his own citizens.

Gazans referred to the pose on the chair, to the ease with which he is sitting, the fact that it is the Rafah crossing (a governmental symbol) - they analyzed every pixel in the photo and even compared it to the famous "victory photo" of Yahya Sinwar smiling on a dusty armchair, legs crossed, at the end of the Guardian of the Walls operation in May 2021.

Here are a variety of examples of responses from Gaza surfers to Netanyahu's photo at the Rafah crossing:

1. ما شاء الله قعدة منتصر !
By God's will, the sitting (posture) of a winner.

2. البلاد صارت بلادهم ؟؟؟ The country became theirs?

3. والله حقه بس ناقصه قهوه.
Wallah, it's his right, he is just missing coffee.

4. فيديو  وصورة بنكهة الانتصار
Video and photo with the flavor of victory

5. اتحدي اي ريس قعد مع جنودة بالعالم العربي زي هاذي القعدة . هنيتنا في قطر وباقي الحاشية في تركيا لعنهم التاريخ
I challenge any head of state in the Arab world to sit like this with his soldiers. Our Haniyeh is in Qatar and the rest of the entourage in Turkey, may history curse them.

6. صحيح وين السنوار يطلع يقعد زيو 🤣🤣
It's true... Where is Sinwar to come out and sit like him?

7. يطلع السنوار يعمل جوله يتفقد الشعب هو كمان
Al-Sinwar should also go out and check on the people like he does

8. هاي رساله مع بصمه لحماس من جهة وللمصريين من جهه راح عمعبر رفح عشان يثبت احتلال المعبر وفيلاديلفيا عشان يقول للمصريين انا فرعون الجديد

This is a message to Hamas on the one hand and to Egypt on the other. He went to the Rafah crossing to establish the conquest of the crossing and the Philadelphi axis to tell the Egyptians I am the new pharaoh

9. قاعد ومرتاح ورجل علي رجل حد يجيب الدويري ابو البذل والقرفتات تاع تحليل

Sitting, relaxed, legs crossed, someone should call al-Dawiri (al-Jazeera's military commentator - AA) with his suits and ties...

10. فوتو شوب قبل الحرب لا يجرأ ان يدخل رفح ذكاء اصطناعي

Photoshop. This is from before the war. He won't dare to enter Rafah.. this is artificial intelligence (sarcasm, mocking the excuses of Hamas supporters for the photo - AA)

##
As you can see in the comments I have attached (and there are hundreds more like them) Netanyahu's entry into Rafah is first and foremost interpreted as an insult to the rule of Hamas, a challenge to their rule and proof that they do not control an area of ​​utmost importance that they ruled in the past. It hurts them a lot. This is especially evident among the Hamas supporters who were quite silent and only briefly answered back at Fatah supporters.

This is of great importance on the level of consciousness. Just as the image of Sinwar after Guardian Edge operation was engraved in the mind, so should images be engraved from the other side.

Here is the comparison the Palestinians made between the two photos 👇👇👇

message:
"Netanyahu's visit to Rafah" effect among Palestinians online

This is without a shadow of a doubt the most talked about event among Palestinians on social networks yesterday.

It was difficult to find Palestinian channels that managed to ignore the photos and videos of the visit to Rafah.

Fatah supporters on social media ridiculed Hamas supporters mercilessly, and Hamas supporters for their part tried to defend themselves by saying that the visit was secret and reported on it only after Netanyahu left Rafah, and "we will see him announcing such a visit in advance".

The effect was particularly strong in light of the contrast with Yahya Sinwar. I will immediately explain:
